intro: Mesosphaerum lanceolatum, commonly known as the lanceolate mesosphaerum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small, fragrant yellow flowers. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in lowland forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for botanical study and horticultural cultivation.
